titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Anna Wipfler Senior Essay and Interviews Documenting Lesbian and Gay Student Activism at Yale
Wipfler (Anna) Senior Essay and Interviews Documenting Lesbian and Gay Student Activism at Yale
titlestmt.author: compiled by Mary Caldera

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday April 3, 2019 at 07:00

did.unittitle: Anna Wipfler senior essay and interviews documenting lesbian and gay student activism at Yale

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The papers consist of Anna Wipfler's (Yale 2009) senior essay, "The Making of 'the Gay Ivy': A History of Lesbian and Gay Student Organizing at Yale, 1969-1987" and her interviews with lesbian and gay Yale alumni.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 49 (YRG 49), Papers and projects on Yale.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the papers is partially restricted. See inventory for details.

Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy for their personal use should consult Copying Services information on the Manuscripts and Archives web site.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Unless otherwise stated in the Collection Contents, copyright has been transferred to Yale University for unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator(s) of this collection. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Anna Wipfler Senior Essay and Interviews Documenting Lesbian and Gay Student Activism at Yale (RU 1097). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Anna Wipfler graduated with a B.A. from Yale College in 2009. Her senior essay research focused on gay and lesbian student activism at Yale College in the 1970s and 1980s.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers consist of Anna Wipfler's senior essay, "The Making of 'the Gay Ivy': A History of Lesbian and Gay Student Organizing at Yale, 1969-1987" and her oral history interviews with lesbian and gay Yale alumni. The papers document gay and lesbian student life and activism at Yale and in New Haven, Connecticut. Student organizations including the Gay Alliance at Yale, the YaLesbians, the Gay and Lesbian Coop, and the Yale Women's Center are well documented in the interviews.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The records are arranged by format; interviews are arranged alphabetically by last name of interviewee.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Permission required from the author to cite or quote during her lifetime or until January 1, 2090.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Albert graduated from Yale College in 1979.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ayres grew up in Kansas City and graduated from Yale College in 1981. She lived in New Haven from 1975 to 1981. She lived off-campus and considered herself a member of the New Haven lesbian community. Topics covered in the interview include the Gay Alliance at Yale, co-founding of YaLesbians, the Yale Women's Center, the New Haven lesbian community, the New Haven Women's Liberation Center, and student and community interactions. Also discussed are the issues that were relevant to Ayres and her cohort including feminism, radical lesbian feminism, racism, classism, and social justice and peace work.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Permission required from the interviewee to cite or quote until January 1, 2037.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
